translation:
Lord Śrī Krishna Chaitanya,
Being gracious upon the jīva-souls,
Along with Your associates and abode
You descended to this world

To distribute freely<br class="SongVerse__break" />the love divine most rare;<br class="SongVerse__break" />By teaching exclusive surrender,<br class="SongVerse__break" />the life and soul of the devotee

Humility, self-giving,<br class="SongVerse__break" />Embracing His guardianship,<br class="SongVerse__break" />‘Krishna will certainly protect me’ —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Maintaining this faith.
Acceptance of all activities<br class="SongVerse__break" />favourable to devotion;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Embracing rejection of<br class="SongVerse__break" />adversity to devotion.
Those who surrender in this sixfold way —<br class="SongVerse__break" />Their prayer will be heard<br class="SongVerse__break" />by the divine son of Nanda.
Taking in his mouth a straw, falling<br class="SongVerse__break" />at the lotus feet of Śrī Rūpa-Sanātan;<br class="SongVerse__break" />Śrī Bhakti Vinod clasps their holy lotus feet.

text: kā̐diyā kā̐diyā bole, āmi to’ adhama
translation: Weeping, weeping, I implore thee,<br class="SongVerse__break" />‘O I am afallen!<br class="SongVerse__break" />Please teach me to surrender,<br class="SongVerse__break" />teach me pure devotion.’
